CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
DECEMBER 17, 2018
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, December 17, 2018

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Marc C. McGovern

Dennis J. Carlone

Dec 17, 2018

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-92, regarding enforcement of the Bike Lane Bill to keep our bicycle infrastructure
free and unobstructed.
CMA 2018 #333
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of a donation from Geoffrey Harris, in the amount of $1,515 to the Grant Fund Police Department
Other Ordinary Maintenance account.
CMA 2018 #331
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

3. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of FY19 Sustained Traffic Enforcement Program (STEP) grant received from the commonwealth of
Massachsuetts Executive Office of Public Safety and Security (EOPSS).
CMA 2018 #332
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [7-1-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Kelley

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

4. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $3,100,000.00 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund Extraordinary Expenditures Account.
CMA 2018 #328
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux


PAGE 2

Dec 17, 2018

5. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $5,000.00 to the Grant Public Celebrations (Arts Council) Other Maintenance account.
CMA 2018 #327
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

6. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of MASSCAP Inc. fund in the amount of $10,573.71 to Grant Fund Human Services Programs Other
Ordinary Maintenance account.
CMA 2018 #330
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

7. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of the Massachusetts Housing and Shelter Alliance Grant from the Department of Housing and
Community Development (DHCD) in the amount of $6,726.62 to the Grant Fund human Services
Programs Salary and Wages account ($1,800.62), and to the Grant fund Human Services Programs
Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($4,926.00).
CMA 2018 #329
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

8. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, In response to Policy Order
No. O-6 of 10/15/18, which contains questions raised by the Council’s Economic and University
Relations Committee at its meeting on October 4, 2018 regarding the establishment of a local
Cannabis Social Equity Program.
CMA 2018 #334
RESULT:
REFERRED TO UNFINISHED BUSINESS ITEM #7

PAGE 3

Dec 17, 2018

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. Airplane Noise Reduction Update on noise and vibrations from a concentration of low-flying
airplanes originating at runway 33L at Logan Airport continue to disturb many residents
POR 2018 #314
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
TABLED AS AMENDED ON AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF 8 MEMBERS
WITH TWO PROPOSED AMENDMENTS SUBMITTED
Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

2. City Council support of Bill H. 4075 Act to Promote Housing Choices, which would allow
municipalities across the Commonwealth to change some zoning rules via a simple majority vote.
POR 2018 #316
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
FAILED OF ADOPTION AS AMENDED [4-4-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an order
requesting the appropriation and authorization to borrow $600,000 to provide funds for the
installation of a new boiler at the Solomon Building at Cambridge Rindge and Latin School and
other related improvements. QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION ON OR AFTER
DECEMBER 24, 2018
CMA 2018 #319
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to an
appropriation and authorization to borrow $3,000,000 to provide funds for the design and
reconstruction of the Tobin School building. QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION ON OR
AFTER DECEMBER 24, 2018
CMA 2018 #320
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

Dec 17, 2018

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) AWAITING HOME RULE LEGISLATION-BEFORE PROPOSAL CAN BE
ORDAINED
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

6. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections. PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

7. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a draft zoning
petition concerning the regulation of cannabis establishments in the City of Cambridge in
response to Awaiting Report Item Number 18-75.
CMA 2018 #192
RESULT:
PASSED TO BE ORDAINED AS AMENDED [7-1-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon, Mayor McGovern,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Zondervan

NAYS:
Councillor Toomey

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Devereux

8. Legal Opinion on Portland's Relocation Assistance Ordinance
POR 2018 #305
Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 1/7/2019 5:30 PM

Dec 17, 2018

PAGE 12

Dec 17, 2018

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager confer with appropriate departments to advance the timetable for updating the
Zoning Code's Table of Uses and determine a frequency at which they can be regularly reviewed and
updated.
POR 2018 #318
Councillor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

2. That the City Manager is requested to confer with City staff, including the City Electrician and the
Director of the Commission for Persons with Disabilities, to determine if there is a safe and effective
way for people to bring power to the curb and cross City sidewalks, to include running power cords
under the sidewalk, to charge electric vehicles and, if so, how the City might best go about
appropriately permitting and monitoring such activity.
POR 2018 #319
Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

3. That the City Manager is requested to confer with City staff with the intent of developing targeting
advertising efforts, to include BlueBike stations, billboards, videos, flyers, paid advertising and other
appropriate means, to educate cyclists in and out of Cambridge about riding safely and responsibly,
with a special focus on the dangers of sharing the road with trucks, especially at intersections.
POR 2018 #320
Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

4. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Assessor's Office on the topic of requiring that
a business entity’s beneficial ownership be disclosed in all Cambridge real estate transactions.
POR 2018 #321
Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

5. City Council support of implementing protected bicycle infrastructure on Museum Way, O’Brien
Highway, and Craigie Bridge, and in urging MassDOT to work with advocates and stakeholders to
ensure the new bridge works for commuters of all transit modes.
POR 2018 #322
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

PAGE 13

Dec 17, 2018

6. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department on a
process for obtaining and analyzing further detailed and specific eviction data.
POR 2018 #323
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY EIGHT MEMBERS

PAGE 14

Dec 17, 2018
